body:
here some more info about 301redirect caches and firefox: https://superuser.com/questions/467999/clear-301-redirect-cache-in-firefox

so I set `browser.cache.check_doc_frequency` to 1, clicked the link which now redirected correctly, then I set it to 3 again which is the default value. I think it is essentially a firefox bug, since FF should in my opinion not store redirects permanently if they lead to 404 - even if it is a permanent redirect.

closing again :)
@mbien: Thanks for the investigation! The F12 method worked for me.
NB21 is the next release version. Please use it as it is without copying it into NB20 when NB21 is released.
In PHP 8.3, override a method should add `#[Override]`
Yes, I know it. I'll add it to the list. Thanks.
I know. My question is if the (fixed) nb21 php module from nightly build can be used with regular nb20 install.

> > I finally found the reason for this malfunction. It looks that for security reasons and during a past update Windows 10 has disabled the clipboard history. It is in my opinion a crazy change also without a clear information to users... by the way we can restore the "classic" clipboard behaviour by tuning the switch available on the System settings under the Clipboard menu on the left. I attach a screenshot, but please forgive me if I pasted the Italian version, so please read the term "appunti" as "clipboard". ![clipboard-history-is-back](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/29631792/287325406-8c075f9a-4fd8-47d8-ac68-21de7933252e.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yak-mQwm6E87Y1ALhJGlpvb40uVqK3DkbsqwsWUvvpc)
> 
> It is on in my PC (For a long time) and the error still happens

Yeah I noted, the issue reastarted soon.

Additional info : 
- still an issue in netbeans 20 (other config the same as above)
- BUT switching on "project properties"->build->compile->"compile on save" seems to be a workaround ? It seems to be a condition which is necessary for "copy static resources on save" to work ? (which is unexpected since for merely copying xhtml-files, compilation does not seem to be required to me ?)

I'm not sure whether it works correctly. If you want to do it, please do it at your own risk. 
Usually, in such a case, please use the dev build version (after the php-nb21-features branch is merged into the master). Or, please wait until NB21 is released.

@MartynasJanu

I don't see any difference between my expected section and your code block.

If it's not clear the issue is in indentation.

![IMG_20231204_115829](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/assets/19204073/0bf00c5c-2784-4d04-94e1-c333f243287c)
Now tests should pass hopefully. There was a missing dependency.

I think the solution is incomplete.
For everyone who is experiencing issues on windows there is another solution : 

Add to windows environment variables. (PC -> System Propreties -> Environment Variables...) the variable : **JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS**

and the value : 
`--add-opens=java.base/java.net=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.desktop/javax.swing=ALL-UNNAMED --add-exports=java.desktop/sun.awt=ALL-UNNAMED`
nice! I would like to help testing this (local smoke test). To avoid that we test it on the same projects, what testing was already done?

I think writing `var v = new ArrayList<>();` is likely a mistake, as it cannot infer anything nice. So a warning does not seem bad to me. I was thinking of this, and when we were generalizing the pattern for the hint, I/we probably went a bit too far. So this:
https://github.com/Achal1607/netbeans/pull/2
limits the warning to only Collections/Maps, and only to constructors that are unlikely to infer something sensible.
Please write an example code.
@mbien Could you please advise on the recommended course of action, or should I await further guidance? Thank you

For 1: I think you are looking for: https://plugins.netbeans.apache.org/catalogue/?id=37
For 2: The "automatic report" facility create many issues, where the reporter did not care about. The assumption that if there is an exception in NetBeans an issue report with just that backtrace would be helpful is false. From my POV only issue reports where authors are willing to do a minimal amout of work (extract errors from message log) are even worth looking at. Everything else is useless noice.

@sdedic to add something from a release perspective, it's a shame that reverts on delivery have to go in to master at all, but they have to with the strategy we have.  However, I see no reason the revised PR could not have been opened as soon as the sync PR had been merged that week, and was somewhat surprised it wasn't.  We ask people to be aware of the potential for the introduction of merge conflicts between each weekly sync, and to leave out really big refactoring (eg. modules / cluster moves) during releases.  Any concern. just ask, and dealing with minor merge conflicts isn't a big issue.  If the wording is unclear, let's change it! :smile:

there are probably a few things which can be tweaked  but I am not sure if changing the background based on the theme is a good idea.

The programs which run in the embedded terminal are outside of NB's control and likely configured to look good with the system terminal color scheme. There will be always a NB theme which will make `htop` look bad.

> and also allow customize it by developers.

you can configure the embedded terminal fonts and colors in the options
Try going to `Tools / Options / Miscellaneous / Terminal` and clicking the restore button.  Does this fix it?

@rothardo you mentioned you made the changes in the UI already, so if you want you can open a PR so that someone can take a look at the changes and test it.

To do that simply push your changes to a new branch of your clone of the NetBeans repo, then you should see a button somewhere which lets you open a PR against the apache repo.

For the following I regrettably can't provide numbers, but I think I can trace it back to the changes this is a followup for:

I noticed that NetBeans became to feel sluggish at work (Windows Laptop) when invoking "Run file" in a semi-big maven project and editing the `pom.xml`. The project is a dropwizard project and pull-in jersey, jetty, jackson, so a not to small number of modules.  What I noticed is that the UI froze for a few seconds after each "Run file"  invocation. UI freezes indicate something heavy blocking the EDT. Indeed, when you add `assert !SwingUtilities.isEventDispatchThread();` to  `org.netbeans.modules.maven.NbMavenProjectImpl.getFreshOriginalMavenProject()` (or a breakpoint there), this is hit when:

- you invoke "Run file"-Method
- you modify the `pom.xml` and save it

The source is here: `MavenProjectNode#getShortDescription` https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/ca7b58b0ab653f09e9fb097549fa19a40b89f742/java/maven/src/org/netbeans/modules/maven/nodes/MavenProjectNode.java#L183

Stacktrace:

```
java.lang.AssertionError
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.NbMavenProjectImpl.getFreshOriginalMavenProject(NbMavenProjectImpl.java:479)
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.problems.MavenModelProblemsProvider.doGetProblems1(MavenModelProblemsProvider.java:165)
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.problems.MavenModelProblemsProvider.doGetProblems(MavenModelProblemsProvider.java:152)
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.problems.MavenModelProblemsProvider.getProblems(MavenModelProblemsProvider.java:131)
	at org.netbeans.spi.project.ui.support.UILookupMergerSupport$ProjectProblemsProviderImpl.getProblems(UILookupMergerSupport.java:274)
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.nodes.MavenProjectNode.getShortDescription(MavenProjectNode.java:183)
	at org.netbeans.modules.maven.nodes.MavenProjectNode$2$1.run(MavenProjectNode.java:92)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(InvocationEvent.java:318)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEventImpl(EventQueue.java:773)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:720)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:714)
	at java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(AccessController.java:399)
	at java.base/java.security.ProtectionDomain$JavaSecurityAccessImpl.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:86)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:742)
	at org.netbeans.core.TimableEventQueue.dispatchEvent(TimableEventQueue.java:136)
[catch] at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(EventDispatchThread.java:203)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(EventDispatchThread.java:124)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:113)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:109)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:101)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:90)
```

The interesting bit is, that `doGetProblems1` is called with `sync = false` in this case. The IMHO correct expectation would be, that the call immediately returns, but `getFreshOriginalMavenProject` seems to block.
what is the rest of the stack trace? Since `CancelAbort` should be likely caught and ignored somewhere indicating that the result is no longer required or the data changed.

@neilcsmith-net I know there is a option to customize the colors in terminal.

But what I expected is the initial color schema applied, it should be set with the color schema **by default**. Like the experience in IDEA, VSCode.
@tmysik Could you please have a look at each commit when you have time?

> Try going to Tools / Options / Miscellaneous / Terminal and clicking the restore button. Does this fix it?

seems to work, reset updates the inherited colors.

btw here an example how it can look when backgrounds are changed without making the terminal program aware of it
![image](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/assets/114367/be548ab1-f936-444f-9da6-027ad73ae548)

however, I played a bit around with other terminals, and as soon you diverge from distro standard terminal color profiles, the programs quickly start clashing too with the colors. So they don't really adjust based of terminal profile. (I only tested bash/gnome terminal which is fairly basic).

this might not be a problem though, since a user which uses a dark NB theme is potentially also using a dark system theme which is hopefully compatible.

I am pretty sure thats how the global actions are implemented. NB has many popups, overlays, search fields etc. If the events would not pass through them by default, a plugin which is in focus could easily unintentionally disable the run action (F6) for example. (I might be wrong but I have the feeling this is by design)
@junichi11 Updated the original post.
@matthiasblaesing It is great. But still hope it is part of the core NetBeans.

If there are no objections, I'll rebase, squash and if GH Actions are green integrate. Seems now is a good time - there should be some time to find and fix issues before the next release. Also 'JEP 458: Launch Multi-File Source-Code Programs' has been integrated today, so it is a high time to have a support for it. (JEP 458 is not the only usecase for this, but it is one of the major ones.)

> I know there is a option to customize the colors in terminal.

@hantsy I was pointing specifically at undoing customization.

I also just tried with an old copy of NB13 I have to hand, and the terminal colours switch automatically when going from light to dark theme.  I've noticed it sometimes not working in the past, but on NB20 it never seems to switch.  We should look at what's changed.

I agree with @mbien about the potential issues with terminal colours, although we also have that issue if/when ANSI colours are used in the output window.

OK, so I just tried NB20 with a clean userdir and it switches automatically.

If you delete `config/Preferences/org/netbeans/modules/terminal/` in the userdir it seems to work again.  So it seems it stops working when customization has been used in the past?

@ebarboni this is meant to be regenerated and updated after the vote in case any PR to delivery has altered things.  May not be any changes.  I'll regenerate and diff with master, and open a PR to update if need be.
OK, verified, and no additional changes.  All good.

The code is here:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/3cc6d772ebeaeaa1779f72ba7d8f7cc206abc952/ide/lib.terminalemulator/src/org/netbeans/lib/terminalemulator/support/TermOptions.java#L152-L158

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/a6aee1b079120feb64062fd8f73eec751a607db6/ide/lib.terminalemulator/src/org/netbeans/lib/terminalemulator/support/TermOptions.java#L220-L264

and if the term options are set once they override everything:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/a6aee1b079120feb64062fd8f73eec751a607db6/ide/lib.terminalemulator/src/org/netbeans/lib/terminalemulator/support/TermOptions.java#L266-L285

The term option might need a "Reset to defaults" button.

> The term option might need a "Reset to defaults" button.

Thanks for the pointer @matthiasblaesing There is already a reset button, well `Restore`, but it doesn't remove the preferences file.  Perhaps that needs a rethink?  I assume the button calls through to https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/ide/lib.terminalemulator/src/org/netbeans/lib/terminalemulator/support/TermOptions.java#L83

I updated the wizard to reflect the problem to the user. Once this stage is reached, the user can't rescue the process, so it is IMHO not a problem, that you can't get back.

![image](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/assets/2179736/e95db956-94a0-4ff2-87a5-1caf04cff746)

That is how far I'm willing to go.

I understand what's it's doing. I think "Restore" should restore the default behaviour, which is currently to change automatically on theme change. Whether that's the right or wrong approach is open to discussion because of the issues mentioned above. But the general principle that resetting something should return you to the out-of-the-box behaviour is important in my opinion - less confusing, and fewer bug reports.

I am sure there is a way to get rid of the config if restore is pressed we could implement, however - I am not sure if this is the right approach.

Since a user which has a different font size set in the terminal and switches theme might want to have it switch colors too, no?

so from birds eye view:
 - the same problem exists with editor colors too, however this is solved since NB can store multiple profiles at the same time, so it simply swtiches to the light/dark default if you click the right notification bubble
 - the terminal can't do that since it has no profiles to switch
 
unless:
the terminal resets (fully or partially) if the NB theme is switched. This might be the better option? It wouldn't matter anymore what the reset button actually does to the config. Since right now it doesn't change if the user has any kind of custom config, even if the config was reset already - maybe it should partially update the config based on theme.
It worked for me. Thank you

> Since a user which has a different font size set in the terminal and switches theme might want to have it switch colors too, no?

Totally agree.  My starting point is that resetting anything should make it work like it did before.  After that, I think there's a bunch of things we could improve.

> the terminal can't do that since it has no profiles to switch

There's a related conversation here with regard to colour output in the Output window.  I think we should look how we can have UI keys or some other mechanism for ANSI colours across the IDE.  See https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/5764#issuecomment-1495783013

Have you tried updating Lombok to 1.18.30 ?

It looks like support is not totally absent

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/5b768b89eb89a511d3e78ea07ad922626feeccad/enterprise/web.jsf/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/jsf/wizards/CompositeComponentWizardPanel.java#L304-L324
@mbien I have opened a PR, hence please let me know if there are any changes required, thank you

@NicolaIsotta has the right suggestion. This is a duplicate of https://github.com/projectlombok/lombok/issues/3468 and https://github.com/projectlombok/lombok/issues/3393.

The TL;DR version is: The price for using lombok is high because it regularly breaks on newer JDKs. And thus I strongly resist people wanting to use lombok @work. We have some legacy code and for that the situation was improved by specifying the lombok version as a property and I override that in my `settings.xml` to point to a recent version of lombok that makes it work again, without having to modify the project.
@jepsar you might get help if you produce a minimal reproducer. Few people want to waste time to learn some new cool feature he does not need just to fix someone elseses problem.

This issue can't be acted upon:

- the message log is missing and no error is reported
- for "it is slow" problems, the IDE has a built-in profiler (Enable "Performance" symbol bar, first icon: ![image](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/assets/2179736/f078172e-ce58-4421-a4f7-17525aa437a6))
- what is a "ski bar"?

You can't "attach" to a javascript file. What is possible depends highly on your environment. JS in the browser currently can't be debugged with NetBeans, but then the Browsers dev tools got pretty good at that. You most probably try to debug a node execution. Then you will be faced with https://github.com/apache/netbeans/issues/4127 on recent node versions.
It turned out that having the components in a folder called `composites` did not work. Renaming it to `components` does work. 🤷🏼‍♂️
would like to start to merge some of the smaller maven PRs this weekend, assuming they are reviewed to shrink the queue a bit.
would like to start to merge a few of my PRs this weekend since they start to pile up, this would be a potential candidate, cc @lahodaj

should the compatibility matrix be still used if `gradle_version_used` > `all_known_versions` to determine JDK compatibility?
You mean give a chance to newer versions of Gradle?

> You mean give a chance to newer versions of Gradle?

yep. If NB doesn't know - the user might :)

We had a similar conversation a while ago with regards to the JavaFX plugin execution goals.  Not sure if there's somewhere we could / should make use of this there too?

I wonder if we should get some upstream (Maven) input on this requirement?  There was certainly some discussion in the earlier conversation about how this sort of thing might be supported (via configuration or convention) such that IDEs could pick up some of this information automatically.
I have pushed changes after making changes as told, was that the right thing to do? I am asking this as I am new to the community

Duplicate: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/issues/4271

[edit] I remember that someone posted a workaround that you could try: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-4468

> I wonder if we should get some upstream (Maven) input on this requirement? There was certainly some discussion in the earlier conversation about how this sort of thing might be supported (via configuration or convention) such that IDEs could pick up some of this information automatically.

The main problem here is that independently developed goals are likely to have their own properties (here, the Micronaut has no `exec.args` full commandline equivalent, and does not support working dir too !); some of the things can be overcomed by action mapping (as in this diff). SpringBoot plugin has also `run` and yet different properties that control it. Actually I shelved yet some other changes that could allow to report not only name, but also property mapping, so the (core) Maven support could determine what of the "standard" features are actually supported. But implementation would take too long, so I deferred that to later time.

Re: past conversation(s) - could you pls. find a link ?
LGTM

@ebarboni @neilcsmith-net should I add more links? Remove the section? Any opinions? Nobody mentioned the links so far and I am not sure about that :)

> I have pushed changes after making changes as told, was that the right thing to do? I am asking this as I am new to the community

thats fine during review, but before merge it would be good if you would squash everything locally to one commit, make sure the commit message is how you like it and then force push into the PR. This PR would have to do that anyway, due to the commit author field, see https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6797#pullrequestreview-1768358808

@cstamas https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6805#issuecomment-1845167382, do tools have to know about non-standard (run) goals and their usage/config or is there a mechanism which would help to discover/map them?
@rothardo this looks correct to me so far - feel free to open a draft PR even if it is not finished. It is easier to comment on code there.

> @cstamas [#6805 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6805#issuecomment-1845167382), do tools have to know about non-standard (run) goals and their usage/config or is there a mechanism which would help to discover/map them?

They def could be discovered by tools, just like https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-help-plugin/describe-mojo.html
Source https://github.com/apache/maven-help-plugin/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/plugins/help/DescribeMojo.java#L374

I's true that NB can **discover** goals and user properties  that control the behaviour using maven model introspection , but I what is needed here is to **recognize** semantics - that a goal "executes" (in some way) the application - and which properties (jf any) serve to pass JVM / commandline arguments, main class, working dir etc.  Is there such semantic categorization in `MojoDescriptor` or `Parameter` ?

right. Well, the old plugin portal isn't validated anymore, it contains old, mostly unmaintained plugins. There is probably nothing we can do about this.

I checked the catalog.xml of the 8.2 update center and the namespace is `org.netbeans.modules.hibernate4lib`. I don't think the code was donated to apache. Its not in https://github.com/timboudreau/netbeans-contrib and not in the netbeans repo.
old jira issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-6300

> Fixed NPE ... you mean the assertion ?

hmm. No NPE fix in this PR. Did you mean to approve the maven mirror PR instead of this by any chance? ;)

Sadly no: goal names as "just strings", there is no semantics attached to it. 

But what if some (human) introspects the given plugin, and deploy some "meta mapping" and NB picks that up? It could be plain artifact somewhere in Central...

Yes, this PR is just that -- except that it does not use artifacts, but NB-specific storage for the information. Low hanging fruit. I would let this to mature a bit (to see what categorization is actually useful and in what shape) before promoting to a wider ecosystem.

Thanks for fixing this. It currently fails to build from source because the ant call from the build script of the `gradle` module causes a wrong base directory to be used. This fixes that:

```diff
# This patch file was generated by NetBeans IDE
# It uses platform neutral UTF-8 encoding and \n newlines.
--- a/extide/gradle/build.xml
+++ b/extide/gradle/build.xml
@@ -58,7 +58,7 @@
     </target>
 
     <target name="build-tooling-lib" depends="-download.release.files,-copy-gradle-wrapper,-uptodate-tooling" unless="tooling.uptodate">
-        <ant antfile="${tooling}/build.xml" inheritAll="false" target="build" />
+        <ant antfile="build.xml" dir="${tooling}" inheritAll="false" target="build" />
         <copy file="${tooling}/build/libs/${tooling}.jar" todir="build/tooling" overwrite="true"/>
         <copy file="${tooling}/src/main/resources/nb-tooling.gradle" todir="build/tooling" overwrite="true"/>
     </target>
```

With that change netbeans builds again.
Note https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Submitting+Pull+Requests?focusedCommentId=283118094#comment-283118094 (I no longer seem to have a valid Confluence login).

I'm inclined to close this immediately. I can turn the sentence

> displaying navgitor please wait Clearly slower than the file editor opening speed, this type of unequal information has a very poor user experience

around and say

> making the user wait for the navigator content to be available makes a bad user experience when the primary goal of the user is to edit the file, which would be available immediately

The answer: No, it is not easy to make this fast, non-intrusive and show up in parallel. The navigator relies on the parsing of the file. This is a hard task and can take siginificantly longer than opening the file. This can be done in the background, but people are already complaining about the indexing work NetBeans is doing in the background, that would get worse.

I have been observing the trend of the Netbneas IDE all along, and its application functions are not bad. The main reason for the problem may be that the IO processing experience has always been very poor, giving users the feeling that their computer configuration is poor. Hi @mbien,

 I've gone through the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/120f2129a8dbc25b7a52542c359fe5a7a2569c60/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) for the NetBeans project and I'm seeking some clarification on the squashing process. I attempted to squash my commits interactively in Vim, but encountered conflicts during the process.

Specifically, I'm puzzled by an unexpected commit in the pull request [6797](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6797). In commit [8916655](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6797/commits/891665543a70e466b4fd862f32b495a3e7b4252c), I reconfigured the author's name. Subsequently, when I executed `git pull`, I noticed an automatic commit [Merge branch 'apache:master' into hudsontojenkins](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6797/commits/32a8216b3179e76031b2767e354d877d055a5bb1).

Could you please provide further guidance on the squashing process and help me understand why the mentioned merge commit was automatically generated? I want to ensure that I follow the correct procedures and address any issues promptly.

Your expertise in clarifying this matter would be greatly appreciated.
